xxl.core.util.concurrency
Interface Channel

All Known Implementing Classes:
AsynchronousChannel, AsynchronousNChannel
public interface Channel

Implements a channel by using semaphores. The concept of channels is well described in Doug Lea: "Concurrent Programming in Java", Second Edition, Sun Microsystems. Online: http://java.sun.com/Series/docs/books/cp/

Method Summary
 boolean attemptTake(Object[] o)
          Tries to read an object from the channel.
 boolean isEmpty()
          Determines if an object is currently in the channel.
 boolean isFull()
          Determines if the channel currently is full.
 void put(Object object)
          Puts an object into the channel.
 Object take()
          Waits for an object that is sent from a different thread via the put method.
 

Method Detail

take

Object take()
Waits for an object that is sent from a different thread via the put method.

Returns:
object from the channel

put

void put(Object object)
Puts an object into the channel.

Parameters:
object - object that is put into the channel

attemptTake

boolean attemptTake(Object[] o)
Tries to read an object from the channel. If an object is not availlable, this method returns false. The object is returned inside the first element of the object array.

Parameters:
o - Object array. The first element is used for returning the desired object
Returns:
true - iff there was an object in the channel

isEmpty

boolean isEmpty()
Determines if an object is currently in the channel.

Returns:
true if the channel currently does not contain any element

isFull

boolean isFull()
Determines if the channel currently is full.

Returns:
true if the channel is currently full
